title: 106_hr2280
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 1999" refers to amendments and repeals in terms of Title 38, United States Code. Section 2 of the Act pertains to disability compensation. Amendments to Section 1114 of Title 38, United States Code increase rates for various subsections, such as raising from $95 to $98, $182 to $188, $279 to $288, and so on. Amendments to Section 1114 of Title 38, United States Code include increasing rates for various subsections, such as raising from $75 to $76, $2,443 to $2,533, $3,426 to $3,553, and so on. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may authorize these increases administratively. The rates of disability compensation for individuals under Public Law 85-857 will be increased administratively, excluding those already receiving compensation under title 38, United States Code. SEC. 3. Additional compensation for dependents is increased in various clauses. SEC. 4. Clothing allowance for certain disabled veterans is also increased. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. SEC. 5. Dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses is increased to $881 for paragraph (1) and $191 for paragraph (2). Monthly pay grade rates for military personnel range from $881 for E-1 to $1,878 for O-10. The surviving spouse's rate varies based on the veteran's rank, ranging from $1,082 for certain senior enlisted positions to $2,013 for top military leadership roles. Amendments to DIC rates for children: Section 1311 updated to increase benefits to $222 from $215, including Aid and Attendance Allowance and Housebound Rate adjustments. SEC. 6. Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Children: Increases DIC rates for orphan children and supplemental DIC for disabled adult children. Amendments include raising benefits to $373, $538, $699, and $136 respectively. Effective date of amendments is December 1, 1999. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on December 1, 1999.
